subject: Art & Design
title: Brand Archetypes: 12 Personalities of Brands
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Brand Archetypes: 12 Personalities of Brands.

hook.text: Harley-Davidson is the Outlaw. Disney is the Magician. Nike is the Hero. Every great brand plays a character.

buildup.text: Carl Jung's archetypes â€” universal personality patterns .

discovery.text: The 12: Hero, Outlaw, Magician, Innocent, Explorer, Sage, Creator, Ruler, Caregiver, Everyman, Lover, Jester.

twist.text: Brands that try to be all archetypes feel generic. The strongest brands commit to one primary archetype.

climax.text: Old Spice was 'Ruler' (traditional). It reinvented as 'Jester' (absurd humor). The archetype shift revived the brand.

punchline.text: Every brand tells a story. Archetypes choose which story it is.

quiz.question: What are brand archetypes based on?
options: Carl Jung's universal personality patterns adapted for branding
